events.title: Freedom Beyond Liberalism: Is Democracy Enough?
events.description: What does it mean to be free in a world that calls itself democratic and liberal? Is democracy enough to sustain true freedom? Drawing on his book Post-Truth Society: A Political Anthropology of Trickster Logic, Prof. Szakolczai explores how manipulation, spectacle, and the loss of shared meaning shape our understanding of liberty and authority.

events.title: Carl Gustav Jung Workshop
events.description: Join this co-hosted event for a collaborative exploration of C.G. Jung's thought, focusing on his distinctive psychological method, the metaphysical framework behind concepts like archetypes and the collective unconscious, and the practical process of shadow work as a path to self-understanding. This interdisciplinary event brings together philosophical depth and psychological insight to illuminate Jung's enduring relevance for how we think, feel, and grow.

events.title: Christmas Movie Session: It's a wonderful life
events.description:
Join us for our final session of the semester! To get in the mood for the season, we'll watch the beautiful & timeless classic "It's a wonderful life" together.
Snacks included!

events.title: Kick-Off / Philosophical Speed-Dating
events.description: Come join us in room 01-113 to discuss philosophical questions under time pressure! Later we‚Äôll go to the Adhoc to deepen our conversations.
